meta[language=en]: id      |key(hex)|key(str)| text
Tips for when i add spaces and : in front of lines. For example if you try to align
the : with the string "Reputation system:", you must count the characters in "Reputation system"
which is 17, then you mulitply by two and remove 1.
There is always some variation since not all letters have the same width, but that should
save you some time.

column1: 2115018140|        |option_rer_min_spawn_distance|<font color="#ffffff">              Distance:</font> minimum spawn distance (in meters)
2115018154|        |option_rer_min_level_range|<font color="#28a745">                  Levels:</font> lowest allowed (relative to Geralt)
2115018174|        |option_rer_event_system_internal_cooldown|Seconds before an event can trigger again
2115018175|        |option_rer_event_fillcreaturesgroup_allow_combat|Event Fill creatures group - allow copy of creatures in combat
2115018264|        |rer_bounty_notice_description|The bounty master is looking for a witcher, as there are monsters to be killed. Come see him to start bounties and sell your trophies
2115018265|        |item_desc_trophy|A monster trophy. The bounty master will probably buy it at a better price.

2115018269|        |rer_tutorial_ambush_body|You have just been <font color="#CD7D03">ambushed</font>. Enemies are now moving towards you and you must fight them. You can run away but they will follow you until you defeat them. Once you do it, you will be rewarded with crowns and trophies. If you do not like being ambushed or wish to change it to be more or less challenging you can change the settings in the Ambushes submenu in the Encounter System Menu.

2115018271|        |rer_tutorial_bounty_body|You have just started a <font color="#CD7D03">bounty</font>. Bounties consist of one main target and a random number of side targets. They will typically spawn at points of interest around the region. The main goal is always to kill the main target. The side targets can be skipped, but if you go out of your way to kill them you increase your reward by 100% for every side target killed. This does also, however, have a side effect of increasing the difficulty of the fight against the main target.

2115018273|        |rer_tutorial_clue_body|You have just <font color="#CD7D03">examined a track</font> left behind by a creature. When examined, Geralt will comment on what monster it is and following the trail will lead you to the creature that created it. Do keep in mind, however, that because RER uses vanilla voicelines, some creatures may be incorrectly identified. However, the family that the creature belongs to will always be correct. For instance, Geralt might find the tracks of a noonwraith, but because there are no voicelines for it he says it’s a nightwraith. They are different creatures, but are in the same family of “wraiths”.

2115018275| |rer_tutorial_contract_body|You have just picked up a custom contract notice that can be distinguished by the poster of the notice always being A. Letoth. When you close this tutorial, a menu will appear showing the following:
- The type of tokens you can acquire from this noticeboard
- Your current reputation
- The contracts available
Note that these factors are unique to each noticeboard in the game
You may have also noticed that the notices used to trigger all the contracts in the vanilla game are absent. This is because RER uses a special reputation system whereby Geralt must earn reputation from completing RER contracts so that the populace know there’s a witcher in the area and will put up the vanilla contracts. The reputation system also controls the type of RER contracts you can receive, starting with easy and working up to hard contracts.

If you do not like this system you can disable it in the Contracts System menu.

2115018277| |rer_tutorial_ecosystem_body|Your recent killing of a creature has indirectly changed the surrounding ecosystem. RER simulates a food chain which changes the creatures you encounter. Whenever you kill creatures, the ecosystem changes. And if you continue to kill, new species can turn up and some can even migrate to other regions. You can examine the ecosystem using the Ecosystem Analysis keybind which can tell you useful info about the creatures and their habitats. This keybind is not set up by default, so if you would like to use it refer to the in depth installation guide.

If you do not like this feature you can change its effects or disable it altogether in the Ecosystem menu.

2115018279|        |rer_tutorial_noticeboard_event_body|You have picked a <font color="#CD7D03">contract notice</font> from the mod Random Encounters Reworked. When you close the window, you will see dialogue options to select the difficulty of the contract, as well as information about the noticeboard. These rewards vary per noticeboard and region, but stay the same for the entire playthrough.

2115018281| |rer_tutorial_rewards_body|You just collected a trophy. These do not serve any purpose outside of being sold for coin, but who you sell them to does matter if you wish to maximise profit.

If you do not like the rewards and wish to change them, then you can do so in the Rewards System menu.
2115018282|        |option_rer_settlement_delay_multiplier|Delay multiplier when in settlements (1 = no change, 2 = twice longer)
2115018283|        |option_rer_dynamic_creatures_size|Dynamic creatures size (scales RER creatures based on their level)

2115018285| |rer_bounty_start_popup|The following creatures were seen and have bounties on their heads,

Main target, required to claim the reward:
{{main_creature_listing}}

Optional side targets:
{{side_creature_listing}}
Whoever brings their trophies to the bounty master will get a sizable reward.
2115018287|        |rer_mappin_bounty_master_description|Go see the bounty master to sell your trophies and learn about new bounties. <font color="#ffd33d">(Click to fast-travel)</font>
2115018289|        |rer_mappin_bounty_main_target_description|{{creature_type}} were seen in the area. Kill them and collect the bounty reward. <font color="#ffd33d">(Click to fast-travel)</font>
2115018291|        |rer_mappin_regular_description|Clues lead to this area, something interesting must be here. <font color="#ffd33d">(Click to fast-travel)</font>
2115018296|        |rer_bounty_master_trophies_bought_notification|The bounty master bought your trophies for {{crowns_amount}} crowns
2115018297|        |rer_bounty_finished_notification|Bounty finished. {{side_groups_killed}} bonus points from side groups killed. You now have a bounty level of {{bounty_level}}.

2115018300| |rer_tutorial_started_body|Welcome to Random Encounters Reworked!
Popups similar to this one will appear whenever something important related to the mod happens in order to explain what is happening. For now, Random Encounters Reworked will not be noticeably active and this is on purpose. To allow users to adapt to the mod and not be bombarded, the mod will introduce parts of itself over the course of 10 hours. By then, users should be well acquainted with how the mod works.

If you need reminding about how a certain event or feature works you can re-enable the tutorial in the mod menu so that when you encounter that event or feature again the popup will also appear again.

meta[language=en]: to translators:
the end is not a typo but simply a random name formed with the letters of Aeltoth, my nickname,
as a way for users to recognise the notices created by RER but without breaking immersion!
and the spaces are so the name appears on the right on the notice.

column1:
2115018302| |rer_noticeboard_errand_0_text|Good Folk!

There's a vile and dangerous spook, beast or devil of sorts causing no end of trouble near our homes. We promise our profoundest gratitude - and a sizeable reward - to any brave lad who can slay it.

- A. Letoth
2115018313|        |option_rer_additional_delay_per_player_level|<font color="#9e9e9e">         Day & Night:</font> Additional delay (in seconds) per player level

2115018315| |rer_noticeboard_errand_1_text|Anyone who knows how to read, read this. And read it carefully, so that it's known far and wide, or at least throughout the whole village.

I was out in the field, hunting for something to eat when I heard the growl. There's a beast that feeds on men. You cannot walk within ten spans of the evil and hope to escape alive. It's thus keeping us from hunting and harvesting our crops, meaning famine and misery await us if nothing changes.

I spied some odd tracks and couldn't for the life of me figure out what left them, even though I've many a hunt under my belt. You know me, I'm not one to make a fuss, but I can't help but reckon they bode ill and we all should be on guard.

If you've the courage and skill, slay the monster for us, and your efforts will surely be rewarded.

- A. Letoth
2115018319|        |option_rer_ecosystem_frequency_mutliplier|<font color="#9e9e9e">         Day & Night:</font> Effects of kills on delays <font size="11">(+100%: faster, -100%: slower)</font>

2115018321| |rer_noticeboard_errand_2_text|To Whom It May Concern:

Let it hereby be known that whoever kills the monsters that's woven their nests near our lands and have taken to killing both men and beasts, will be given a sizable reward. Kill enough beasts, and you'll become famed throughout the lands, and your purse'll be heavy with gold.

- A. Letoth

meta[language=en]: Do not translate the "{{creature_name}}", this will be replaced with the actual
creature name dynamically.
Thank you!

column1: 2115018336|        |option_rer_allow_learn_new_locations|Allow RER to learn about new locations as you explore

meta[language=en]: this line is the one displayed when starting a contract, for example:
- Close and easy Ogroids contract
- Far and hard Draconids contract
the {{distance}} will be replaced by either "far" or "close"
the {{difficulty}} will be replaced the preset_value_rer_easy translation high above
the {{species}} will be replaced by the species translated just above.

column1: 2115018366|        |rer_token_gear_description|This token of gratitude, obtained from your contracts all across the world, can be traded to the bounty master in exchange of gear.

it should look like this once localized:
Gear (7 left)
{{reward_type}} are the `rer_token_type_short` lines you translated above.
{{tokens_amount}} is the number of tokens the player has in his inventory.

2115018412|        |rer_tutorial_bounty_level_body|Once you have finished a bounty, your <font color="#CD7D03">bounty level</font> may increase. Each region has its own bounty level. Whenever you increase your bounty level, you will receive an item. This item will increase in rarity with your bounty level.

2115018413|        |rer_tutorial_bounty_master_body|You have found the <font color="#CD7D03">Bounty master</font>, a character that can give you bounties. He travels all around the world so he can be found in every region. However, he does also move within those regions. To find him look on your map and search for a yellow exclamation mark surrounded by a white circle.

2115018472| |rer_level_scaling_no_level_detected|It looks like you are using a "No Level" mod or a mod that adjusts your level dynamically. The Mod & Level scaling setting from Random Encounters Reworked is now set to use your play-time instead of the player level.

If you don't like this change or if you think there is an error, you can manually change it in Random Encounters Reworked's general mod menu.
2115018484|        |rer_confirm_back_to_camp_description|Do you wish to fast travel back to where you accepted the contract?
